==Toyota War== I think the [[Chadian-Libyan conflict#Toyota War|#Toyota War]] section has enough content to be split off into its own article, like what's been done to [[Opération Epervier]] and [[Chadian-Libyan conflict#Opération Epervier|#Opération Epervier]]. It would certainly help with the length. Do others agree? [[User talk:Picaroon9288|Picaroon]] 19:17, 28 January 2007 (UTC) :Thanks for the suggestion Picaroon, it seems a great idea to me, and when I've finished the article I'll certainly create [[Toyota War]]. Have you any ideas to give me? I would really appreciate some criticism!--[[User:Aldux|Aldux]] 22:35, 28 January 2007 (UTC) ::The textual content is certainly well-written and well cited. But the visual content is lacking. Images, even if they aren't completely on topic (like, say, one of Deby or Qaddafi just standing around) would make it look better - and easier to read. Also, a map showing the path of the advance and retreat of Libyan forces might help. I'll go check Commons to see if anything looks like it'll be useful. [[User talk:Picaroon9288|Picaroon]] 22:41, 28 January 2007 (UTC) I've added an image, but there are two problems. One, the colors are a bit garish. Two, the rest of the article seems very unbalanced, because it has no images. Commons searches under "libya," "chad," and "aozou" didn't yield very much. I'll check articles on the politicians involved and see if the have anything. [[User talk:Picaroon9288|Picaroon]] 22:56, 28 January 2007 (UTC)
== Conflict? ==
Why is it called "conflict"? Wasn't it a war?
[[Special:Contributions/62.152.110.130|62.152.110.130]] ([[User talk:62.152.110.130|talk]]) 19:14, 30 November 2008 (UTC)
==Lead==
The lead could do with some work, but I don't know where to start :| - [[User:f-m-t|Francis Tyers]] [[User_talk:f-m-t|·]] 14:28, 5 February 2007 (UTC)
== Inconsistent dates? ==
I am somewhat mystified by ''<nowiki>beginning with the extension of the [[Chadian Civil War (1979-1982)|Chadian Civil War]] to northern Chad in 1968.</nowiki>'' [[User:87.112.88.209|87.112.88.209]] 19:52, 6 October 2007 (UTC) :I'm not responsible for that title. What is agreed by consensus among Chadianists is that the civil war erupted in 1965 with the [[Mangalmé riots]] and the foundation of the [[FROLINAT]] in 1966. What is pretty confusing is not when it started, but when it ended; various dates have been given, the most common being 1987, 1990 and 1993.--[[User:Aldux|Aldux]] 20:06, 6 October 2007 (UTC)
==Images== I think if there are some more ilustration this article can become featured article.--[[user:vojvodaen|Vojvodae]] [[user talk:vojvodaen|please be free to write :)]] 19:25, 24 August 2011 (UTC)
{{Talk:Chadian–Libyan conflict/GA1}}
